titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Valerian Ivanovich Moravskii Papers, 1917-1937.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Olga Verhovskoy Dunlap; machine-readable finding aid created by James Ryan

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-01-21T11:20-0800

change.item: Revised to update encoding and add unitid
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Valerian Ivanovich Moravskii Papers)//EN" "reg_195.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, resolutions, proclamations, financial and legal records, and photographs, relating to the Russian Civil War in Siberia, the anti-Bolshevik Siberian governments of 1918-1922, the Council of Plenipotentiary Representatives of Organizations of Autonomous Siberia, political activities of White Russian emigres in the Far East and elsewhere, and Russian emigre-Japanese relations.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Valerian Ivanovich Moravskii Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1948.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

odd.head: Explanatory Notes
odd.p: Throughout this register the following abbreviation is used : C.P.R.O.A.S. for the Council of Plenipotentiary Representatives of the Organizations of Autonomous Siberia, (Sovet Upolnomochennykh Organizatsii Avtonomnoi Sibiri).
Throughout this register correspondence is arranged by writer, and thereunder by addressee.

chronitem.event: Graduates from a theological seminary in Bessarabia and the Institute of Agronomy in St. Petersburg. Attends the Academy of Oriental Languages in St. Petersburg
Works on staff of newspaper Rech' as head of Far Eastern section
Works for Ministry of Ways and Communications
Appointed head of Ministry of Food Supply in Provisional Government under Kerensky
Appointed Secretary General of Siberian Provincial Council

Elected State Secretary of Siberian Provincial Duma. Member of the Provisional Government of Autonomous Siberia. Elected to the Council of Plenipotentiary Representatives of the Organizations of Autonomous Siberia
Appointed Minister of Finance and Minister of Trade and Industry in second (non-Bolshevik) Siberian Government
Emigrates to China. Lives in Shanghai and travels extensively in Manchuria and Japan
Elected Vice-President of Council of Plenipotentiary Representatives of the Organizations of Autonomous Siberia
Becomes Acting President of Council of Plenipotentiary Representatives of Autonomous Siberia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes miscellaneous documents, correspondence, reports and printed material dealing with the period 1918-1920. arranged by physical form.

did.unittitle: Correspondence. Includes miscellaneous correspondence of P. Derber, Chairman of the Siberian Government and other members of the government re its recognition by foreign powers and the political situation in Siberia, March-July 1918
List of members of the Constituent Assembly, n.d.

Miscellaneous proclamations of the Plenipotentiaries of the Siberian Provisional Government, June-Nov. 1918

"Deklaratsiia Sibirkago Pravitel'stva". Signed A.V. Sazonov, M.P. Golovachev and G.I. Chertkov, Oct. 1922
Miscellaneous reports to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, (Provisional Government of Siberia), Aug.-Sept. 1918
Report re unlawful activities of Ataman Kalmykov, Sept. 1918
Report on violations of law by Japanese authorities in Vladivostok, Sept. 1918

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents, correspondence and excerpts from printed material dealing with anti-Communist military forces and their relations with the Council of Plenipotentiary Representatives of the Organizations of Autonomous Siberia. Includes material on Lt. Gen. Ataman G.M. Semenov, Lt. Gen. A.N. Pepeliaev and other generals representing the Cossack armies of Siberia. Arranged by physical form.

did.unittitle: Decree of Admiral Kolchak transferring civil and military authority to Lt. Gen. G.M. Semenov, Jan. 1920. (English translation)

Legal agreement between Lt. Gen. G.M. Semenov and C.P.R.O.A.S., Feb. 7, 1922. (Includes French and English translation)
Testimony of Lt. Gen. G.M. Semenov re agreement of Feb. 1922, Feb. 1926

Deposition of A.V. Sazonov re agreement of Feb. 1922, n.d.
"Obrashchenie k Sibirskomu Pravitel'stvu," signed Lt. Gen. Ataman Semenov, n.d.
Writings. "Appeal to the American People," (a brief history of his anti-Bolshevik campaign, 1917-1922), 1922
Agapov, E.M., letter re activities of "Semenovtsy" in Shanghai, May 1924
Cherednichenko-Mersie, V.P., report to G.M. Semenov, Nov. 1927

Printed material. "Delo Generala Pepeliaeva," Zarubezhnaia Rus', No. 70, Shanghai, Feb. 9, 1922
Military groups and others recognizing the C.P.R.O.A.S. as the government of Siberia. Arranged chronologically

Council of the Plenipotentiary Representatives of the Organizations of Autonomous Siberia, (C.P.R.O.A.S.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous material of the Council of the PLenipotentiary Representatives of the Organizations of Autonomous Siberia. Includes correspondence and reports of affiliated sections; material re activity of intelligence section; miscellaneous reports, especially about Siberia; biographical material and personal documents of its members; memoranda, resolutions and protocols of meetings. Arranged by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Material re relations of the Russian emigre community in the Far East with China, Czechoslovakia and Japan. Includes treaties and agreements with Chinese and Japanese authorities, reports, maps, printed matter and correspondence. Arranged alphabetically by topic.

scopecontent.p: Reports on the economic situation in the Far East; contracts and agreements to establish commercial enterprises and miscellaneous material re Russian banks in the Far East. Includes material on Mongolia. Arranged by topic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Material re attempts by the Council of Plenipotentiary Representatives of the Organizations of Autonomous Siberia and its representatives to recover monies, gold and supplies of the Imperial and Provisional Governments deposited abroad or confiscated by Chinese and Japanese authorities. Includes documents and correspondence dealing with the so-called Kolchak gold and the Podtiagin and Miller Affairs. Arranged by topic.

Emigre Organizations in the Far East

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, publications, proclamations, protocols of meetings and resolutions of Russian emigre political and social organizations in the Far East. Arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence of the Russian emigre community of the Far East with the League of Nations and reports and miscellaneous material re railroads in China and Manchuria. Arranged by topic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous correspondence of members and affiliates of the Council of Plenipotentiary Representatives of the Organizations of Autonomous Siberia. Includes correspondence of G.I. Chertkov, V.I. Moravskii, M.P. Golovachev and A.V. Sazonov. Arranged alphabetically by author with correspondents listed below in alphabetical order.

Personal correspondence with family in Soviet Union, n.d.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manuscripts, mostly on the history and politics of Siberia. Includes drafts of articles for Vol'naia Sibir'. Also includes excerpts from published (?) materials. Arranged alphabetically by author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a short autobiography by V.I. Moravskii and biographical sketches of other members of the Council of Plenipotentiary Representatives of the Organizations of Autonomous Siberia found in the collection. Also includes explanatory notes by V.I. Moravskii and the original register compiled by him. Arranged by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 12 postcard caricatures of members of the Maritime Parliamen; * Yenisei Okhrana file photos of Bolshevik revolutionaries, including F. Dzerzhinski, L. Kamanev, L. Krasin, V.I. Lenin, M. Litvinov, J. Stalin, L. Trotsky and G. Zinoviev; 2 prints of visit by Chiang Kai-shek to Soviet Consulate in Shanghai.
